intro: Echites macranthus, commonly known as the large-flowered echites, is a striking plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its showy, large, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Echites macranthus thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
